message_1: Suppose you want to encode the message "MATH" using the one-time pad encryption technique. The plaintext is represented as a sequence of numbers from 0 to 25, where A=0, B=1, C=2, and so on until Z=25. To encode the message, you have been given the following key: 12 18 05 02. Using this key, determine the ciphertext that would result from encrypting the message "MATH".
message_2:
To encode the message "MATH" using the one-time pad encryption technique, we first convert the letters to their corresponding numerical values:

M = 12
A = 0
T = 19
H = 7

Now, we add the key (12 18 05 02) to the numerical values of the plaintext, modulo 26:

(12 + 12) % 26 = 24
(0 + 18) % 26 = 18
(19 + 5) % 26 = 24
(7 + 2) % 26 = 9

The resulting ciphertext is the sequence of numbers: 24 18 24 9

Now, we convert these numbers back to letters:

24 = Y
18 = S
24 = Y
9 = J

So, the ciphertext for the message "MATH" using the given key is "YSYJ".
